attributes.action: Stop the new doctor's contract being imposed, return to negotiations with BMA
attributes.additional_details:
On 13 August 2015, the BMA decided not to re-enter contract negotiations for junior doctors. This was because the BMA held firm to their negotiation points which can be found in the link below. 

On 15 September 2015 the UK Government announced it will impose a new contract on junior doctors working in England from August 2016. 

http://bma.org.uk/news-views-analysis/news/2015/september/the-bma-will-fight-any-attempts-to-impose-a-contract
attributes.background: Stop the new contract which is going to be imposed on NHS non-consultant doctors in England, and instead return to negotiations with the BMA in order to avoid the threat of strike action. This new contract holds majors risks to both patient safety and to doctor’s psychological well-being.

rejection.details:
I'm sorry - we cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/108782

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
